--- title: "title" author: "Philippe Massicotte" date: "2022-10-27" categories: [R, ...] # The preview file needs to be named preview.png # mogrify -format png preview.jpg # https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-tools.html#preview-images image: "img/preview.png" editor_options: chunk_output_type: console draft: true --- I am often facing the situation where students come to my office with *spatial* data in a plain csv file they want to place on an existing grid. Working in the Arctic, such grid is often the MODIS mapped grid. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(terra) rast() #> class : SpatRaster #> dimensions : 180, 360, 1 (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution : 1, 1 (x, y) #> extent : -180, 180, -90, 90 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 ``` ::: ![Photo by Rehan Syed on Unsplash](img/preview.png){fig-alt="Close up on a grain field" fig-align="center"} Check the code used for Inge.
